thread.title: Top 25 Chefs in the Bay Area
thread.title_full: Top 25 Chefs in the Bay Area

author: David Mitroff, Oakland Business Examiner
title: Top 25 Chefs in the Bay Area
text:
Top 25 Chefs in the Bay Area Use your key for the next article Comment 
Are you a hungry Bay Area native? Do you ever feel like there’s nothing good to eat in this side of California? Fret not, for good eateries indeed exist in the San Francisco Bay Area and surrounding turf. The following presents a range of the most esteemed chefs in the Bay Area proper. Though by no means exhaustive, for those seeking to eat some of Northern California’s best should take care to check out some of these great picks: 
1) Thomas Keller of French Laundry – Yountville, CA3 Michelin stars, French cuisine with an American twist and fixed-priced menus 
2) Christorpher Kostow of Restaurant at Meadowood – St. Helena, CA3 Michelin stars, located in Napa Valley featuring fine contemporary California cuisine along with choice wines 
3) Corey Lee of Benu – San Francisco, CA3 Michelin stars, minimalist setting in the SoMa district of SF with American fusion and an exquisite tasting menu 
4) Joshua Skenes of Saison – San Francisco, CA3 Michelin stars, New American cuisine with a famous tasting menu 
5) Alice Waters of Chez Panisse – Berkeley, CAFrequently ranked as one of the top restaurants in the world, uses local organic ingredients for its signature dishes, inspired the Californian cuisine cooking style 
6) David Kinch of Manresa – Los Gatos, CA2 Michelin stars, New American cuisine with fresh tasting menus 
7) Dominique Crenn of Atelier Crenn – San Francisco, CA2 Michelin stars, innovative French cuisine in a minimalist setting 
8) Suzette Gresham of Acquerello – San Francisco, CA2 Michelin stars, fine Italian cuisine and wines in a chapel-turned-restaurant setting 
9) Bruno Chemel of Baumé – Palo Alto, CA2 Michelin stars, French fine dining with fixed-price menus 
10) Daniel Patterson of Coi – San Francisco, CA2 Michelin stars, experimental California-French tasting menus using local ingredients 
11) Michael Tusk of Quince – San Francisco, CA2 Michelin stars, French-Italian dishes using seasonal ingredients 
12) Hiro Sone and Lissa Doumani of Ame – San Francisco, CA1 Michelin star, blend of France-Italian flavors with a Japanese edge, complimented by an extensive wine list 
13) Nancy Oakes of Boulevard – San Francisco, CA1 Michelin star, New American cuisine along with a lovely view of the bay 
14) Jarad Gallagher of Chez TJ – Mountain View, CA1 Michelin star, French cuisine with set meals in a Victorian setting 
15) Steve Litke of Farmhouse Inn & Restaurant – Forestville, CA1 Michelin star, New American cuisine with wonderful Sonoma and Napa wine 
16) Gray Danko of Gary Danko – San Francisco, CA1 Michelin star, elegant American cuisine with fixed-price menus 
17) Roland Passot of La Folie – San Francisco, CA1 Michelin star, French cuisine with fixed-price menu 
18) Ken Frank of La Toque – Napa, CA1 Michelin star, New French cuisine within the Westin Verasa hotel 
19) Peter Rudolph of Madera – Menlo Park, CA1 Michelin star, New American seasonal selections with a wonderful view 
20) Jesse Mallgren of Madrona Manor – Healdsburg, CA1 Michelin star, New American farm-to-table menu with views of Sonoma vineyards 
21) Michael Mina of Michael Mina – San Francisco, CA1 Michelin star, New American power-dining spot in SF’s Financial District 
22) Peter Armellino of Plumed Horse – Saratoga, CA1 Michelin star, California cuisine in a stylish and exquisite setting 
23) Brandon Sharp of Solbar – Calistoga, CA1 Michelin star, California eatery with wines at the Solage Resort 
24) Matt McNamara and Teague Moriarty of Sons & Daughters – San Francisco, CA1 Michelin star, New American eatery with tasting menu and wine pairings 
25) Hiro Sone of Terra – St. Helena, CA1 Michelin star, New American farm-to-table tasting menus in a chic farmhouse setting
